stoicism.text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

stoicism.text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don't have.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.
stoicism.author: Seneca

stoicism.text: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
stoicism.author: Epictetus

stoicism.text: The obstacle is the way.
stoicism.author: Ryan Holiday

stoicism.text: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
stoicism.author: Marcus Aurelius

productivity.text: Focus is the art of knowing what to ignore.
productivity.author: James Clear

productivity.text: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.
productivity.author: James Clear

productivity.text: Every action you take is a vote for the type of person you wish to become.
productivity.author: James Clear

productivity.text: The most dangerous distractions are the ones you love, but that don't love you back.
productivity.author: James Clear

productivity.text: Be so good they can't ignore you.
productivity.author: Steve Martin

productivity.text: Deep work is the ability to focus without distraction on a cognitively demanding task.
productivity.author: Cal Newport

productivity.text: Clarity about what matters provides clarity about what does not.
productivity.author: Cal Newport

productivity.text: If you don't pay appropriate attention to what has your attention, it will take more of your attention than it deserves.
productivity.author: David Allen

productivity.text: Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.
productivity.author: David Allen

productivity.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
productivity.author: Mark Twain

productivity.text: Done is better than perfect.
productivity.author: Sheryl Sandberg

productivity.text: Efficiency is doing things right. Effectiveness is doing the right things.
productivity.author: Peter Drucker

productivity.text: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
productivity.author: Peter Drucker

productivity.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
productivity.author: Walt Disney

productivity.text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
productivity.author: Pablo Picasso

productivity.text: Simplicity boils down to two steps: Identify the essential. Eliminate the rest.
productivity.author: Leo Babauta

productivity.text: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.
productivity.author: William Penn

productivity.text: Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence.
productivity.author: Paul J. Meyer

productivity.text: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion.
productivity.author: Parkinson's Law

productivity.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
productivity.author: Steve Jobs

productivity.text: Discipline equals freedom.
productivity.author: Jocko Willink

productivity.text: How we spend our days is how we spend our lives.
productivity.author: Annie Dillard

productivity.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
productivity.author: Arthur Ashe

productivity.text: Small daily improvements are the key to staggering long-term results.
productivity.author: Robin Sharma

productivity.text: What gets measured gets managed.
productivity.author: Peter Drucker

success.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
success.author: Winston Churchill

success.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
success.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

success.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
success.author: Thomas Edison

success.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
success.author: Confucius

success.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
success.author: Nelson Mandela

success.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
success.author: Theodore Roosevelt

success.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
success.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

success.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
success.author: Henry David Thoreau

success.text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
success.author: John D. Rockefeller

success.text: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
success.author: Thomas Jefferson

success.text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
success.author: Colin R. Davis

success.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
success.author: Winston Churchill

success.text: If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time.
success.author: Steve Jobs

success.text: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
success.author: Vidal Sassoon

success.text: Don't be distracted by criticism. The only taste of success some people get is to take a bite out of you.
success.author: Zig Ziglar

success.text: What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise.
success.author: Oscar Wilde

success.text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
success.author: Albert Einstein

success.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
success.author: Wayne Gretzky

success.text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
success.author: Henry Ford

success.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
success.author: Chinese Proverb

success.text: Your time is limited. Don't waste it living someone else's life.
success.author: Steve Jobs

success.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
success.author: Albert Einstein

success.text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
success.author: Tony Robbins

success.text: Risk more than others think is safe. Dream more than others think is practical.
success.author: Howard Schultz

success.text: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
success.author: Steve Jobs

fitness.text: The body achieves what the mind believes.
fitness.author: Napoleon Hill

fitness.text: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
fitness.author: Jim Rohn

fitness.text: The only bad workout is the one that didn't happen.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: Strength does not come from the body. It comes from the will.
fitness.author: Gandhi

fitness.text: No pain, no gain. Shut up and train.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: Your body can stand almost anything. It's your mind that you have to convince.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: The pain you feel today will be the strength you feel tomorrow.
fitness.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

fitness.text: Don't limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: Sweat is fat crying.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
fitness.author: Gary Player

fitness.text: Champions aren't made in gyms. Champions are made from something deep inside them.
fitness.author: Muhammad Ali

fitness.text: It's not about having time. It's about making time.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: The difference between try and triumph is a little umph.
fitness.author: Marvin Phillips

fitness.text: Dead last is greater than did not finish, which trumps did not start.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
fitness.author: Vince Lombardi

fitness.text: Success isn't given. It's earned in the gym, on the track, on the field.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
fitness.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

fitness.text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
fitness.author: Zig Ziglar

fitness.text: Motivation gets you started. Habit keeps you going.
fitness.author: Jim Ryun

fitness.text: If it doesn't challenge you, it doesn't change you.
fitness.author: Fred DeVito

fitness.text: Sore today, strong tomorrow.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: Fall down seven times, stand up eight.
fitness.author: Japanese Proverb

fitness.text: The real workout starts when you want to stop.
fitness.author: Ronnie Coleman

fitness.text: Excuses don't burn calories.
fitness.author: Unknown

fitness.text: Train insane or remain the same.
fitness.author: Unknown
